attributes.action: Financial help for self employed CHILDMINDERS during Coronavirus crisis
attributes.additional_details:
"Every child matters" but apparently not every childcare provider does. 
Government forced us to shut during the coronavirus crisis, now please give us the chance to survive. 

Nurseries can apply for grants to pay up to 80% of their staffs wages, yet childminders are being told to apply for universal credit or statutory sick pay.
Many others like me will be forced to close their business' once this is all over. I face months of not being able to feed my son and then homelessness at the end.
attributes.background:
Make financial grants available for self employed childminders who have been forced by government to close their settings during the coronavirus crisis. 
We are in a unique position with no help. 
I face months with no income, and no home by the end of this. Please give us a chance to survive.

rejection.details:
Since this petition was started, the Government has said that most self-employed people can claim a taxable grant worth 80% of their trading profits up to a maximum of £2,500 per month for the next 3 months.

You can find out who is eligible and how to apply here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/claim-a-grant-through-the-coronavirus-covid-19-self-employment-income-support-scheme

You can find out what other Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
